programme.title: Office Christmas Party (2016)
programme.desc: When his uptight CEO sister threatens to shut down his branch, the branch manager throws an epic Christmas party in order to land a big client and save the day, but the party gets way out of hand...

programme.title: Ad Astra (2019)
programme.desc: Astronaut Roy McBride undertakes a mission across an unforgiving solar system to uncover the truth about his missing father and his doomed expedition that now, 30 years later, threatens the universe

programme.title: Gravity (2013)
programme.desc: Two astronauts work together to survive after an accident leaves them stranded in space

programme.title: Road House (1989)
programme.desc: A tough bouncer is hired to tame a dirty bar

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Dan Walker and Louise Minchin present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: HealthCheck UK Live
programme.desc: Daily advice for viewers in self-isolation due to the Covid-19 outbreak.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell visit a house in London's Plaistow, a shell of a property in Lancashire, and a flat in Stoke-on-Trent as they are sold at auction.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A boy taking part in a karting race is sent flying into the air while his father watches helplessly, and a man who dived into a river to save a drowning dog needs rescuing as well.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Anita Manning hosts as experts Tim Weeks and Caroline Hawley help the reds and blue teams find bargains at the antiques centre in Elsecar, South Yorkshire. Plus, Anita views a Meissen collection.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Sid and Bear bond, while Valerie's lunch plans are anything but a picnic. Daniel's old friend gets more than he bargained for when he sets up a dating website.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Armed only with a telescope, the priest hopes that a broken leg will not prevent him from solving the mystery surrounding the death of a member of Kembleford's Women's Institute. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams, Sorcha Cusack, Nancy Carroll and Tom Chambers.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley helps an Oxford couple find a new home on the West Sussex coast, and dons protective gear to join a conservation project protecting nature's most productive workers.(n)

programme.title: The Customer Is Always Right
programme.desc: Consumers get to grips with educational artistic toys, cleaning products designed for getting rid of pet hair, and a pregnancy extension panel for a walking jacket.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Arusha Irvine and Angus Ashworth traverse south-west Wales, where they learn about traditional boats and sheep farming before attending an auction in Carmarthen.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Amol Rajan present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Peter realises Bobby has a crush on Dotty and knocks his brother's confidence - but it doesn't stop the teenager turning up at the club and doing his best to impress the hostess. Linda is adamant she cannot return to her support group with Phil there, leaving Shirley and Mick frustrated. A powercut adds to the tensions between Gray and Chantelle, while Denise realises Patrick and Sheree are both hiding something and hatches a plan to uncover what is going on.(n)

programme.title: Life and Birth
programme.desc: A 22-year-old father-to-be must face his fear of surgery when his partner needs a caesarean section after the baby's heart rate starts to dip. A mother of four boys prepares to give birth to her fifth child, and being an old hand at delivery, soon has a new addition to her brood with no complications. A high-risk pregnancy is closely monitored, and a woman who has been in the hospital for a week is still waiting for the birth of her first baby to begin - but she and her partner are prepared to work as a team when the time comes.(n)

programme.title: Our Girl
programme.desc: Georgie returns to active duty in Afghanistan in the run-up to election day, and discovers that the fake Omar being held in custody has admitted to being a decoy. Georgie is advised to keep a low profile following her recent troubles, but after an assassination attempt on a US dignitary, she realises what is really going on - Elvis' killer is closer to home than she thought and planning a devastating attack. Mimi comes to terms with her past, Throbber earns his stripes, and Dr Bahil looks to the future.(n)

programme.title: Hot Property
programme.desc: Yung Filly helps a bisexual woman from Manchester who has never had a girlfriend to explore the bedrooms of three potential partners, leading her to uncover some surprises and one very familiar looking bedroom.(n)

programme.title: Killing Eve
programme.desc: Carolyn and Eve are left reeling, while Villanelle finds that management is not all that it is cracked up to be. Eve strikes up an unlikely alliance with Kenny's colleagues at the Bitter Pill. Spy thriller, starring Jodie Comer and Sandra Oh.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Double Olympic silver medal-winning swimmer Jazz Carlin, former England goalkeeper Rob Green, Wimbledon wheelchair tennis champion Jordanne Whiley and Great Britain athlete Jeanette Kwakye join team captains Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell and host Sue Barker on the quiz.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather. Presented by Dan Walker and Louise Minchin.(n)

programme.title: HealthCheck UK Live
programme.desc: Daily advice for viewers in self-isolation due to the Covid-19 outbreak.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The presenters follow the progress of a semi-detached in Farnworth near Bolton, a one-bedroom apartment in Trent Vale, Stoke-on-Trent, and a listed building in Maidstone, Kent.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: Two divers documenting a wreck in the Thames find more than they bargained for and call in the Royal Navy bomb team. An unsafe load on a vehicle flies off, landing on a windscreen.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Charles Hanson and Danny Sebastian help two teams in Brackley, Northamptonshire, while presenter Natasha Raskin Sharp finds out more about life at Combe Mill, Oxfordshire.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Medical drama series set in a busy Midlands surgery. Ayesha gets involved in trying to track down the relatives of a woman who the authorities are unable to identify.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A troubled young woman's father is killed three weeks after the death of her mother, leaving the priest to console the bereaved while trying to solve a puzzling murder. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams, Sorcha Cusack and Tom Chambers.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a couple fulfil a long-held dream of moving to the Scottish countryside of Ayrshire. Alongside a selection of the region's best properties that a budget of Â£450,000 can buy, Nicki also pays a visit to the 18th-century Dumfries House, home to one of the finest collections of furniture in the world.(n)

programme.title: The Customer Is Always Right
programme.desc: Customers test out three new products, including a vegan skincare range, a coat for drying dogs, and a device designed to attach items of hand luggage together.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Arusha Irvine and Angus Ashworth continue to scour the shops of South Wales for antiques, where one expert takes a punt on a piece of local history.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Amol Rajan present the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and the Rich brothers compete to transform a garden for a family in Walsall. With three generations living under the same roof, privacy is paramount, so the designers have their work cut out transforming the plot into a stylish area that the family can relax in, in comfort and away from prying eyes.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Gramophone guru Tim Weeks takes on the repair of an antique wooden phonograph, brought into the Repair Shop by Nicola Dean, whose father was an avid collector. This particular model was his prized possession and the centrepiece of his collection. However, it suffered badly in a collision with a group of overenthusiastic small children, and the distinctive wooden horn has become separated from the main body of the item. Plus, upholsterer Sonnaz Nooranvary is faced with an unusual challenge when an armchair is brought in, and Steve Fletcher takes on a battered old miner's lamp, which once saved the life of its owner Hubert John.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The contestants are asked to insert an invisible zip and pockets on a pair of palazzo pants, while the judges keep a keen eye on how well they pattern-match the bold prints. For the transformation challenge, the sewers must turn towels into stylish beach cover-ups in just 90 minutes. Male models arrive in the Sewing Room for the final challenge, ready to be fitted with a made-to-measure holiday shirt using bright and colourful fabrics. Whose shirt will bring on the sunshine, and who will be sent packing?(n)

programme.title: In My Skin
programme.desc: With Trina sectioned again and Bethan at her lowest ebb, she decides to fight back - throwing herself into the running for head girl and competing against Poppy.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: The comedian, actor, writer and director looks back over his eventful career in showbusiness, recalling singing on an Irish chat show. Featuring a special appearance by comedian and presenter Paddy McGuinness.(n)

programme.title: Catchpoint
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness hosts the family-friendly game show combining physical fun and an exciting question mechanic, as contestants have to think fast as they answer questions while trying to catch balls of various sizes dropped from the studio ceiling, with a variety of entertaining rounds and a cash prize at stake.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: HealthCheck UK Live
programme.desc: Daily advice for viewers in self-isolation due to the Covid-19 outbreak.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell view properties in Clapham, London, Maidstone, Kent and Whitehaven, Cumbria.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A skier suffers a leg injury in a remote part of the Alps, so her guide tries to carry her to safety on his back. A girl calls 999 when her mum goes into anaphylactic shock.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents from Brighton Racecourse Antiques Fair, with the help of experts Danny Sebastian and John Cameron, and relives the 1960s with a group of original mods.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Jimmi confronts his demons, while Rob and Karen have a new arrival at home. Sid tries to help a student who has taken desperate measures to avoid mounting debts.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest is unconvinced when a recently returned PoW is accused of killing his uncle, and it seems that someone will stop at nothing to keep Father Brown from the truth. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a couple searching for a property in rural Worcestershire on a budget of Â£475,000, and sees how making flower confetti is a blooming business. Nicki has picked a perfect time to be in the county, as she gets to see how harvesting fields of delphiniums to make flower confetti is both a blooming business and a riot of colour on one historic family farm.(n)

programme.title: The Customer Is Always Right
programme.desc: Consumers test and score an eco-lunchbox, an all-in-one waterproof coat for children and a cafetiere accessory that avoids having to scoop up the mushy grains when finished.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Arusha Irvine and Angus Ashworth tour the West Country, where Roo meets Exmoor's equine inhabitants and Angus bares all at an exclusive beach that can only be accessed by tunnel.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Amol Rajan host the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest.(n)

programme.title: For Love or Money
programme.desc: Kym Marsh and Ashley John-Baptiste track down a man who made off with a woman's savings, and look at how social media profiles and pictures can be hijacked by criminals.(n)

programme.title: Coronavirus: Clap For Our Carers
programme.desc: Live coverage as people around the UK applaud health service workers battling the coronavirus pandemic.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: Homes for Veterans - Part One
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team take on their most ambitious project to date and transform a whole street of run-down empty properties in Manchester into homes for veterans. They are joined by the local community, as well as Prince William and Prince Harry, who volunteer their assistance on site. In the first edition of the two-part special, the team builds houses for two former soldiers who fought in Iraq and Afghanistan and are suffering from post-traumatic stress disorder. However, with the number of volunteers lacking and the buildings proving to be trickier than expected, the build is becoming the toughest yet.(n)

programme.title: The Real Marigold Hotel
programme.desc: Eight celebrities embark on an experimental adventure to India, to see whether they can set up a more rewarding life than in the UK. Enterpreneur Duncan Bannatyne, designer Zandra Rhodes, comedian Paul 'Chuckle' Elliott, cricket legend Henry Blofeld, former EastEnder John Altman, actresses Britt Ekland and Susie Blake and singer Barbara Dickson arrive at their new home by the sea in Puducherry, and while Britt struggles with the heat and Paul misses his missus, Susie, Barbara and Zandra bond over a bit of traditional Indian cooking.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests to answer questions from viewers at home on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week.(n)

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: Adam Fleming, Laura Kuenssberg and Fergus Walsh discuss the latest on the coronavirus crisis.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news. Plus, current affairs, arts and entertainment and weather.(n)

programme.title: HealthCheck UK Live
programme.desc: Angela Rippon is live from her own home with her daily pick of viewers' thoughts and messages from the inbox, and Mr Motivator is back with a bumper workout. Xand Van Tulleken and Michelle Ackerley guide viewers through the challenge of keeping mentally and physically healthy.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A run-down bungalow in Earley in Berkshire, a Victorian terrace with lots of period features in Norwich and a pair of semis in Burton-on-Trent with a fabulous river view are all sold under the hammer. All the developers have ambitious plans for their auction buys and hope to make some money, so Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell monitor whether their ideas are realised.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: Nick Knowles recounts the story of a young woman who slipped and fell near the top of Snowdon in atrocious weather conditions, prompting Mountain Rescue to battle 100mph winds to save her. Plus, how paramedics fought to save the life of a cardiac patient whose heart stopped three times on the way to hospital.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents from the Gloucester Antiques Centre, where the red and blue teams go shopping for treasures with experts Kate Bliss and Charles Hanson. Away from the contest, Charlie learns about Glevum Games, a local company which was at the top of its game at the start of the 20th century.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: As part of Ramadan, Shak and Ruhma volunteer at a renovation project for homeless people. However, both get more than they bargained for when Shak meets a frustrated daughter and Ruhma discovers one of the workers is secretly sleeping at the project.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A death on a local farm is blamed on a Kembleford doctor through a series of poison pen letters, and Father Brown must try to find out who sent them to save his friend from the gallows. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams and Sorcha Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Margherita Taylor travels through the countryside of the East Midlands with a couple who want to invest their Â£650,000 budget in a character property with space for their young family. Along the way, Margherita visits a Leicestershire dairy farm, where a husband-and-wife duo have diversified and revived a 300-year-old recipe for the region's most famous cheese, Red Leicester, making them the only producers of Leicester cheese made with unpasteurised milk in the county.(n)

programme.title: The Customer Is Always Right
programme.desc: Customers test and score a brush for pets, a storage solution for tin cans and a versatile, mouldable plastic stick that can be shaped into various kinds of tool. Presented by Lucy Alexander.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Arusha Irvine enjoys the fun of the fair, while Angus Ashworth heads to Plymouth to discover the turbulent history of gin, before having a go as a Master Distiller. They then join up at their final auction in Clevedon, north Somerset.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Amol Rajan introduce the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: World champion speedskater Elise Christie, 2008 Olympic 400m winner Christine Ohuruogu, former England cricketer Ryan Sidebottom and Great Britain gymnast Nile Wilson join team captains Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell and host Sue Barker on the quiz.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Michael is having problems with a classmate - but it might not be the best idea for his father to decide to get involved and invite the culprit's parents over for dinner. Comedy, starring Robert Lindsay and Zoe Wanamaker.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan hosts the satirical current affairs quiz, with actor-comedian Maisie Adam and radio host James O'Brien joining regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's events.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host reviews trending news stories before connecting to star guests via the internet. Although there is no studio audience, the jokes and stories remain plentiful, while the notorious Red Chair feature remains - now relocated to the comfort of the viewers' own armchairs at home.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: A bonus episode of the series featuring a package of musical highlights. Plus, a special appearance from chief medical officer Professor Chris Whitty.(n)

programme.title: The Full Monty
programme.desc: Six unemployed men from Sheffield decide to become strippers for one night only in a bid to raise extra money. However, with no dancing experience and far from perfect physiques, the men rely on the unique selling point of complete nudity to impress the punters. Comedy, starring Robert Carlyle, Mark Addy, Tom Wilkinson, Hugo Speer and Paul Barber.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Cookery show featuring guest chefs and celebrities as well as highlights from the BBC Archives and wine choices for the dishes prepared in the studio.(n)

programme.title: Nadiya's Family Favourites
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain makes indulgent dishes for special treats, including a ham and cheese crown that's fit for royalty, creamy spinach and paneer kati rolls, a fluffy chicken and rice bake that's bursting with flavour, and sticky syrup sponge balls. Nadiya's quest to make the perfect rice takes her to a laboratory in Bristol where she meets rice expert Dr Stuart Farrimond, while her desire to understand more about where honey comes from lands her at Robert Nemeth's beehives in Hassocks, West Sussex.(n)

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Dan Walker and guests present football news and archive action.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Terraced houses in Newcastle-under-Lyme and Offerton are sold under the hammer, and presenters Martel Maxwell, Dion Dublin and Martin Roberts meet the new owners.(n)

programme.title: World Cup Rewind
programme.desc: Guy Mowbray presents a look back at England v Argentina from 1998 and West Germany v France from 1982.(n)

programme.title: Monsters vs Aliens
programme.desc: A woman is exposed to radiation from a meteorite that causes her to grow to an enormous size during her wedding. She is captured by the military and held prisoner with an assortment of strange creatures - but when aliens invade, these freaks of nature are the only ones capable of saving the world. Animated sci-fi comedy, with the voices of Reese Witherspoon and Hugh Laurie.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades salvages three items to transform from Altrincham Recycling Centre - mattress springs, an old writing bureau and a broken granite worktop.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson heads to Herefordshire with a house-hunting couple who have a Â£600,000 budget. He also visits a potato farm run by the same family for almost 100 years.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: The Rich brothers and Charlie Dimmock travel to Petersfield, Hampshire, competing to create a secluded Japanese-inspired relaxation area at the end of a couple's long garden.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys hosts as sports presenters Mike Bushell and Vassos Alexander, and authors Jenny Colgan and Stanley Johnson take to the black chair to answer questions on their respective specialist subjects of Monty Python, Emil Zatopek, the Manhattan Project and Sophocles, before being tested on their general knowledge.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Tommy Boyd, Andy Crane, Brinsley Forde, Denise Pearson, Linda Lusardi, Vicki Michelle, Jan Leeming and John Kettley take part in a special 1980s edition of the general knowledge quiz, in which they try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public. Plus, a special performance from Jason Donovan. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Up to his eyes in work, an overwhelmed Noel is brushed off by Connie, but is quickly distracted by a troubled teenager in the emergency department, who has inured her hand punching a car door, and her mother Sandi. Meanwhile, Dylan does what he can to help an overwhelmed Faith as she struggles to cope while Luka is in chemotherapy, and things become complicated for Fenisha when a patient on a call-out helps her to make a life changing decision about her unborn baby. Starring Tony Marshall and Olivia D'Lima.(n)

programme.title: Outnumbered
programme.desc: Another guest arrives to stay as the family tries to get rid of Auntie Angela, and Sue has to make a decision about Jake's girlfriend. Elsewhere, Ben and Karen discuss dreams, the Mafia and trampolining bears. Comedy, starring Claire Skinner, Daniel Roche and Ramona Marquez.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The bride-to-be goes on a hen party, while Gavin embarks on two stag nights, the second of which reveals shocking secrets about his fiancee that could jeopardise the wedding. Elsewhere, the early return of Stacey's brother Jason horrifies Uncle Bryn. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne and Joanna Page.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The day of the wedding arrives and Bryn is still behaving oddly around Stacey's brother. Nessa debates whether to share her big secret and Smithy resolves to give a superb best man's speech - but finds himself overcome with emotion under the spotlight. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.sub-title: Match of the Day: Top Ten Podcast
programme.desc: Gary Lineker is joined by Alan Shearer and Ian Wright to present the countdown, featuring memorable archive action.(n)

programme.title: Match of Their Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights from three classic Premier League matches, as chosen by some of the regular expert analysts that appear on the show.(n)

programme.title: The Company You Keep
programme.desc: A respected lawyer is forced to go on the run when a reporter exposes the truth about him - he is really a member of a radical militant group wanted for questioning in a murder case, who has been living under a fake identity for 30 years. As the fugitive goes in search of his old allies for sanctuary, the reporter delves into his past and uncovers disturbing secrets. Thriller based on the novel by Neil Gordon, directed by and starring Robert Redford, with Shia LaBeouf, Julie Christie and Susan Sarandon.(n)
